00082 static int popsize;             /* the size of the population */
00083 static int numvars;             /* the number of input variables in the ckt. */
00084 /* storedd stores the population orders and sizes. This table has two
00085 ** extra rows and one extras column. The two extra rows are used for the
00086 ** offspring produced by a crossover. Each row stores one order and its
00087 ** size. The order is stored by storing the indices of variables in the
00088 ** order in which they appear in the order. The table is in reality a
00089 ** one-dimensional array which is accessed via a macro to give the illusion
00090 ** it is a two-dimensional structure.
00091 */
00092 static int *storedd;
00093 static st_table *computed;      /* hash table to identify existing orders */
00094 static int *repeat;             /* how many times an order is present */
00095 static int large;               /* stores the index of the population with
00096                                 ** the largest number of nodes in the DD */
00097 static int result;
00098 static int cross;               /* the number of crossovers to perform */
00099 
00100 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00101 /* Macro declarations                                                        */
00102 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00103 
00104 /* macro used to access the population table as if it were a
00105 ** two-dimensional structure.
00106 */
00107 #define STOREDD(i,j)    storedd[(i)*(numvars+1)+(j)]
00108

00119 static int largest ARGS(());

00122 static int array_compare ARGS((const char *array1, const char *array2));
00123 static int find_best ARGS(());
00124 static double find_average_fitness ARGS(());
00125 static int PMX ARGS((int maxvar));
00126 static int roulette ARGS((int *p1, int *p2));

00139 
00155 int
00156 cuddGa(
00157   DdManager * table /* manager */,
00158   int  lower /* lowest level to be reordered */,
00159   int  upper /* highest level to be reorderded */)
00160 {
00161     int         i,n,m;          /* dummy/loop vars */
00162     int         index;
00163     double      average_fitness;
00164     int         small;          /* index of smallest DD in population */
00165 
00166     /* Do an initial sifting to produce at least one reasonable individual. */
00167     if (!cuddSifting(table,lower,upper)) return(0);
00168 
00169     /* Get the initial values. */
00170     numvars = upper - lower + 1; /* number of variables to be reordered */
00171     if (table->populationSize == 0) {
00172         popsize = 3 * numvars;  /* population size is 3 times # of vars */
00173         if (popsize > 120) {
00174             popsize = 120;      /* Maximum population size is 120 */
00175         }
00176     } else {
00177         popsize = table->populationSize;  /* user specified value */
00178     }
00179     if (popsize < 4) popsize = 4;       /* enforce minimum population size */
00180 
00181     /* Allocate population table. */
00182     storedd = ALLOC(int,(popsize+2)*(numvars+1));
00183     if (storedd == NULL) {
00184         table->errorCode = CUDD_MEMORY_OUT;
00185         return(0);
00186     }
00187 
00188     /* Initialize the computed table. This table is made up of two data
00189     ** structures: A hash table with the key given by the order, which says
00190     ** if a given order is present in the population; and the repeat
00191     ** vector, which says how many copies of a given order are stored in
00192     ** the population table. If there are multiple copies of an order, only
00193     ** one has a repeat count greater than 1. This copy is the one pointed
00194     ** by the computed table.
00195     */
00196     repeat = ALLOC(int,popsize);
00197     if (repeat == NULL) {
00198         table->errorCode = CUDD_MEMORY_OUT;
00199         FREE(storedd);
00200         return(0);
00201     }
00202     for (i = 0; i < popsize; i++) {
00203         repeat[i] = 0;
00204     }
00205     computed = st_init_table(array_compare,array_hash);
00206     if (computed == NULL) {
00207         table->errorCode = CUDD_MEMORY_OUT;
00208         FREE(storedd);
00209         FREE(repeat);
00210         return(0);
00211     }
00212 
00213     /* Copy the current DD and its size to the population table. */
00214     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00215         STOREDD(0,i) = table->invperm[i+lower]; /* order of initial DD */
00216     }
00217     STOREDD(0,numvars) = table->keys - table->isolated; /* size of initial DD */
00218 
00219     /* Store the initial order in the computed table. */
00220     if (st_insert(computed,(char *)storedd,(char *) 0) == ST_OUT_OF_MEM) {
00221         FREE(storedd);
00222         FREE(repeat);
00223         st_free_table(computed);
00224         return(0);
00225     }
00226     repeat[0]++;
00227 
00228     /* Insert the reverse order as second element of the population. */
00229     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00230         STOREDD(1,numvars-1-i) = table->invperm[i+lower]; /* reverse order */
00231     }
00232 
00233     /* Now create the random orders. make_random fills the population
00234     ** table with random permutations. The successive loop builds and sifts
00235     ** the DDs for the reverse order and each random permutation, and stores
00236     ** the results in the computed table.
00237     */
00238     if (!make_random(table,lower)) {
00239         table->errorCode = CUDD_MEMORY_OUT;
00240         FREE(storedd);
00241         FREE(repeat);
00242         st_free_table(computed);
00243         return(0);
00244     }
00245     for (i = 1; i < popsize; i++) {
00246         result = build_dd(table,i,lower,upper); /* build and sift order */
00247         if (!result) {
00248             FREE(storedd);
00249             FREE(repeat);
00250             st_free_table(computed);
00251             return(0);
00252         }
00253         if (st_lookup(computed,(char *)&STOREDD(i,0),(char **)&index)) {
00254             repeat[index]++;
00255         } else {
00256             if (st_insert(computed,(char *)&STOREDD(i,0),(char *)(long)i) ==
00257             ST_OUT_OF_MEM) {
00258                 FREE(storedd);
00259                 FREE(repeat);
00260                 st_free_table(computed);
00261                 return(0);
00262             }
00263             repeat[i]++;
00264         }
00265     }
00266 
00267 #if 0
00268 #ifdef DD_STATS
00269     /* Print the initial population. */
00270     (void) fprintf(stdout,"Initial population after sifting\n");
00271     for (m = 0; m < popsize; m++) {
00272         for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00273             (void) fprintf(stdout," %2d",STOREDD(m,i));
00274         }
00275         (void) fprintf(stdout," : %3d (%d)\n",STOREDD(m,numvars),repeat[m]);
00276     }
00277 #endif
00278 #endif
00279 
00280     small = find_best();
00281     average_fitness = find_average_fitness();
00282 #ifdef DD_STATS
00283     (void) fprintf(stdout,"\nInitial population: best fitness = %d, average fitness %8.3f",STOREDD(small,numvars),average_fitness);
00284 #endif
00285 
00286     /* Decide how many crossovers should be tried. */
00287     if (table->numberXovers == 0) {
00288         cross = 3*numvars;
00289         if (cross > 60) {       /* do a maximum of 50 crossovers */
00290             cross = 60;
00291         }
00292     } else {
00293         cross = table->numberXovers;      /* use user specified value */
00294     }
00295 
00296     /* Perform the crossovers to get the best order. */
00297     for (m = 0; m < cross; m++) {
00298         if (!PMX(table->size)) {        /* perform one crossover */
00299             table->errorCode = CUDD_MEMORY_OUT;
00300             FREE(storedd);
00301             FREE(repeat);
00302             st_free_table(computed);
00303             return(0);
00304         }
00305         /* The offsprings are left in the last two entries of the
00306         ** population table. These are now considered in turn.
00307         */
00308         for (i = popsize; i <= popsize+1; i++) {
00309             result = build_dd(table,i,lower,upper); /* build and sift child */
00310             if (!result) {
00311                 FREE(storedd);
00312                 FREE(repeat);
00313                 st_free_table(computed);
00314                 return(0);
00315             }
00316             large = largest();  /* find the largest DD in population */
00317 
00318             /* If the new child is smaller than the largest DD in the current
00319             ** population, enter it into the population in place of the
00320             ** largest DD.
00321             */
00322             if (STOREDD(i,numvars) < STOREDD(large,numvars)) {
00323                 /* Look up the largest DD in the computed table.
00324                 ** Decrease its repetition count. If the repetition count
00325                 ** goes to 0, remove the largest DD from the computed table.
00326                 */
00327                 result = st_lookup(computed,(char *)&STOREDD(large,0),(char
00328                 **)&index);
00329                 if (!result) {
00330                     FREE(storedd);
00331                     FREE(repeat);
00332                     st_free_table(computed);
00333                     return(0);
00334                 }
00335                 repeat[index]--;
00336                 if (repeat[index] == 0) {
00337                     int *pointer = &STOREDD(index,0);
00338                     result = st_delete(computed, (char **)&pointer,NULL);
00339                     if (!result) {
00340                         FREE(storedd);
00341                         FREE(repeat);
00342                         st_free_table(computed);
00343                         return(0);
00344                     }
00345                 }
00346                 /* Copy the new individual to the entry of the
00347                 ** population table just made available and update the
00348                 ** computed table.
00349                 */
00350                 for (n = 0; n <= numvars; n++) {
00351                     STOREDD(large,n) = STOREDD(i,n);
00352                 }
00353                 if (st_lookup(computed,(char *)&STOREDD(large,0),(char
00354                 **)&index)) {
00355                     repeat[index]++;
00356                 } else {
00357                     if (st_insert(computed,(char *)&STOREDD(large,0),
00358                     (char *)(long)large) == ST_OUT_OF_MEM) {
00359                         FREE(storedd);
00360                         FREE(repeat);
00361                         st_free_table(computed);
00362                         return(0);
00363                     }
00364                     repeat[large]++;
00365                 }
00366             }
00367         }
00368     }
00369 
00370     /* Find the smallest DD in the population and build it;
00371     ** that will be the result.
00372     */
00373     small = find_best();
00374 
00375     /* Print stats on the final population. */
00376 #ifdef DD_STATS
00377     average_fitness = find_average_fitness();
00378     (void) fprintf(stdout,"\nFinal population: best fitness = %d, average fitness %8.3f",STOREDD(small,numvars),average_fitness);
00379 #endif
00380 
00381     /* Clean up, build the result DD, and return. */
00382     st_free_table(computed);
00383     computed = NULL;
00384     result = build_dd(table,small,lower,upper);
00385     FREE(storedd);
00386     FREE(repeat);
00387     return(result);
00388 
00389 } /* end of cuddGa */

00409 static int
00410 make_random(
00411   DdManager * table,
00412   int  lower)
00413 {
00414     int i,j;            /* loop variables */
00415     int *used;          /* is a number already in a permutation */
00416     int next;           /* next random number without repetitions */
00417 
00418     used = ALLOC(int,numvars);
00419     if (used == NULL) {
00420         table->errorCode = CUDD_MEMORY_OUT;
00421         return(0);
00422     }
00423 #if 0
00424 #ifdef DD_STATS
00425     (void) fprintf(stdout,"Initial population before sifting\n");
00426     for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00427         for (j = 0; j < numvars; j++) {
00428             (void) fprintf(stdout," %2d",STOREDD(i,j));
00429         }
00430         (void) fprintf(stdout,"\n");
00431     }
00432 #endif
00433 #endif
00434     for (i = 2; i < popsize; i++) {
00435         for (j = 0; j < numvars; j++) {
00436             used[j] = 0;
00437         }
00438         /* Generate a permutation of {0...numvars-1} and use it to
00439         ** permute the variables in the layesr from lower to upper.
00440         */
00441         for (j = 0; j < numvars; j++) {
00442             do {
00443                 next = rand_int(numvars-1);
00444             } while (used[next] != 0);
00445             used[next] = 1;
00446             STOREDD(i,j) = table->invperm[next+lower];
00447         }
00448 #if 0
00449 #ifdef DD_STATS
00450         /* Print the order just generated. */
00451         for (j = 0; j < numvars; j++) {
00452             (void) fprintf(stdout," %2d",STOREDD(i,j));
00453         }
00454         (void) fprintf(stdout,"\n");
00455 #endif
00456 #endif
00457     }
00458     FREE(used);
00459     return(1);
00460 
00461 } /* end of make_random */

00463 
00477 static int
00478 sift_up(
00479   DdManager * table,
00480   int  x,
00481   int  x_low)
00482 {
00483     int        y;
00484     int        size;
00485 
00486     y = cuddNextLow(table,x);
00487     while (y >= x_low) {
00488         size = cuddSwapInPlace(table,y,x);
00489         if (size == 0) {
00490             return(0);
00491         }
00492         x = y;
00493         y = cuddNextLow(table,x);
00494     }
00495     return(1);
00496 
00497 } /* end of sift_up */
00498 
00499 
00513 static int
00514 build_dd(
00515   DdManager * table,
00516   int  num /* the index of the individual to be built */,
00517   int  lower,
00518   int  upper)
00519 {
00520     int         i,j;            /* loop vars */
00521     int         position;
00522     int         index;
00523     int         limit;          /* how large the DD for this order can grow */
00524     int         size;
00525 
00526     /* Check the computed table. If the order already exists, it
00527     ** suffices to copy the size from the existing entry.
00528     */
00529     if (computed && st_lookup(computed,(char *)&STOREDD(num,0),(char **)&index)) {
00530         STOREDD(num,numvars) = STOREDD(index,numvars);
00531 #ifdef DD_STATS
00532         (void) fprintf(stdout,"\nCache hit for index %d", index);
00533 #endif
00534         return(1);
00535     }
00536 
00537     /* Stop if the DD grows 20 times larges than the reference size. */
00538     limit = 20 * STOREDD(0,numvars);
00539 
00540     /* Sift up the variables so as to build the desired permutation.
00541     ** First the variable that has to be on top is sifted to the top.
00542     ** Then the variable that has to occupy the secon position is sifted
00543     ** up to the second position, and so on.
00544     */
00545     for (j = 0; j < numvars; j++) {
00546         i = STOREDD(num,j);
00547         position = table->perm[i];
00548         result = sift_up(table,position,j+lower);
00549         if (!result) return(0);
00550         size = table->keys - table->isolated;
00551         if (size > limit) break;
00552     }
00553 
00554     /* Sift the DD just built. */
00555 #ifdef DD_STATS
00556     (void) fprintf(stdout,"\n");
00557 #endif
00558     result = cuddSifting(table,lower,upper);
00559     if (!result) return(0);
00560 
00561     /* Copy order and size to table. */
00562     for (j = 0; j < numvars; j++) {
00563         STOREDD(num,j) = table->invperm[lower+j];
00564     }
00565     STOREDD(num,numvars) = table->keys - table->isolated; /* size of new DD */
00566     return(1);
00567 
00568 } /* end of build_dd */
00569 
00570 
00584 static int
00585 largest(
00586    )
00587 {
00588     int i;      /* loop var */
00589     int big;    /* temporary holder to return result */
00590 
00591     big = 0;
00592     while (repeat[big] > 1) big++;
00593     for (i = big + 1; i < popsize; i++) {
00594         if (STOREDD(i,numvars) >= STOREDD(big,numvars) && repeat[i] <= 1) {
00595             big = i;
00596         }
00597     }
00598     return(big);
00599 
00600 } /* end of largest */

00614 static int
00615 rand_int(
00616   int  a)
00617 {
00618     return(Cudd_Random() % (a+1));
00619 
00620 } /* end of rand_int */

00635 static int
00636 array_hash(
00637   char * array,
00638   int  modulus)
00639 {
00640     int val = 0;
00641     int i;
00642     int *intarray;
00643 
00644     intarray = (int *) array;
00645 
00646     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00647         val = val * 997 + intarray[i];
00648     }
00649 
00650     return ((val < 0) ? -val : val) % modulus;
00651 
00652 } /* end of array_hash */
00653 
00654 
00667 static int
00668 array_compare(
00669   const char * array1,
00670   const char * array2)
00671 {
00672     int i;
00673     int *intarray1, *intarray2;
00674 
00675     intarray1 = (int *) array1;
00676     intarray2 = (int *) array2;
00677 
00678     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00679         if (intarray1[i] != intarray2[i]) return(1);
00680     }
00681     return(0);
00682 
00683 } /* end of array_compare */
00684

00697 static int
00698 find_best(
00699    )
00700 {
00701     int i,small;
00702 
00703     small = 0;
00704     for (i = 1; i < popsize; i++) {
00705         if (STOREDD(i,numvars) < STOREDD(small,numvars)) {
00706             small = i;
00707         }
00708     }
00709     return(small);
00710 
00711 } /* end of find_best */

00713 
00725 static double
00726 find_average_fitness(
00727    )
00728 {
00729     int i;
00730     int total_fitness = 0;
00731     double average_fitness;
00732 
00733     for (i = 0; i < popsize; i++) {
00734         total_fitness += STOREDD(i,numvars);
00735     }
00736     average_fitness = (double) total_fitness / (double) popsize;
00737     return(average_fitness);
00738 
00739 } /* end of find_average_fitness */

00741 
00755 static int
00756 PMX(
00757   int  maxvar)
00758 {
00759     int         cut1,cut2;      /* the two cut positions (random) */
00760     int         mom,dad;        /* the two randomly chosen parents */
00761     int         *inv1;          /* inverse permutations for repair algo */
00762     int         *inv2;
00763     int         i;              /* loop vars */
00764     int         u,v;            /* aux vars */
00765 
00766     inv1 = ALLOC(int,maxvar);
00767     if (inv1 == NULL) {
00768         return(0);
00769     }
00770     inv2 = ALLOC(int,maxvar);
00771     if (inv2 == NULL) {
00772         FREE(inv1);
00773         return(0);
00774     }
00775 
00776     /* Choose two orders from the population using roulette wheel. */
00777     if (!roulette(&mom,&dad)) {
00778         FREE(inv1);
00779         FREE(inv2);
00780         return(0);
00781     }
00782 
00783     /* Choose two random cut positions. A cut in position i means that
00784     ** the cut immediately precedes position i.  If cut1 < cut2, we
00785     ** exchange the middle of the two orderings; otherwise, we
00786     ** exchange the beginnings and the ends.
00787     */
00788     cut1 = rand_int(numvars-1);
00789     do {
00790         cut2 = rand_int(numvars-1);
00791     } while (cut1 == cut2);
00792 
00793 #if 0
00794     /* Print out the parents. */
00795     (void) fprintf(stdout,
00796                    "Crossover of %d (mom) and %d (dad) between %d and %d\n",
00797                    mom,dad,cut1,cut2);
00798     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00799         if (i == cut1 || i == cut2) (void) fprintf(stdout,"|");
00800         (void) fprintf(stdout,"%2d ",STOREDD(mom,i));
00801     }
00802     (void) fprintf(stdout,"\n");
00803     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00804         if (i == cut1 || i == cut2) (void) fprintf(stdout,"|");
00805         (void) fprintf(stdout,"%2d ",STOREDD(dad,i));
00806     }
00807     (void) fprintf(stdout,"\n");
00808 #endif
00809 
00810     /* Initialize the inverse permutations: -1 means yet undetermined. */
00811     for (i = 0; i < maxvar; i++) {
00812         inv1[i] = -1;
00813         inv2[i] = -1;
00814     }
00815 
00816     /* Copy the portions whithin the cuts. */
00817     for (i = cut1; i != cut2; i = (i == numvars-1) ? 0 : i+1) {
00818         STOREDD(popsize,i) = STOREDD(dad,i);
00819         inv1[STOREDD(popsize,i)] = i;
00820         STOREDD(popsize+1,i) = STOREDD(mom,i);
00821         inv2[STOREDD(popsize+1,i)] = i;
00822     }
00823 
00824     /* Now apply the repair algorithm outside the cuts. */
00825     for (i = cut2; i != cut1; i = (i == numvars-1 ) ? 0 : i+1) {
00826         v = i;
00827         do {
00828             u = STOREDD(mom,v);
00829             v = inv1[u];
00830         } while (v != -1);
00831         STOREDD(popsize,i) = u;
00832         inv1[u] = i;
00833         v = i;
00834         do {
00835             u = STOREDD(dad,v);
00836             v = inv2[u];
00837         } while (v != -1);
00838         STOREDD(popsize+1,i) = u;
00839         inv2[u] = i;
00840     }
00841 
00842 #if 0
00843     /* Print the results of crossover. */
00844     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00845         if (i == cut1 || i == cut2) (void) fprintf(stdout,"|");
00846         (void) fprintf(stdout,"%2d ",STOREDD(popsize,i));
00847     }
00848     (void) fprintf(stdout,"\n");
00849     for (i = 0; i < numvars; i++) {
00850         if (i == cut1 || i == cut2) (void) fprintf(stdout,"|");
00851         (void) fprintf(stdout,"%2d ",STOREDD(popsize+1,i));
00852     }
00853     (void) fprintf(stdout,"\n");
00854 #endif
00855 
00856     FREE(inv1);
00857     FREE(inv2);
00858     return(1);
00859 
00860 } /* end of PMX */
00861 
00862 
00875 static int
00876 roulette(
00877   int * p1,
00878   int * p2)
00879 {
00880     double *wheel;
00881     double spin;
00882     int i;
00883 
00884     wheel = ALLOC(double,popsize);
00885     if (wheel == NULL) {
00886         return(0);
00887     }
00888 
00889     /* The fitness of an individual is the reciprocal of its size. */
00890     wheel[0] = 1.0 / (double) STOREDD(0,numvars);
00891 
00892     for (i = 1; i < popsize; i++) {
00893         wheel[i] = wheel[i-1] + 1.0 / (double) STOREDD(i,numvars);
00894     }
00895 
00896     /* Get a random number between 0 and wheel[popsize-1] (that is,
00897     ** the sum of all fitness values. 2147483561 is the largest number
00898     ** returned by Cudd_Random.
00899     */
00900     spin = wheel[numvars-1] * (double) Cudd_Random() / 2147483561.0;
00901 
00902     /* Find the lucky element by scanning the wheel. */
00903     for (i = 0; i < popsize; i++) {
00904         if (spin <= wheel[i]) break;
00905     }
00906     *p1 = i;
00907 
00908     /* Repeat the process for the second parent, making sure it is
00909     ** distinct from the first.
00910     */
00911     do {
00912         spin = wheel[popsize-1] * (double) Cudd_Random() / 2147483561.0;
00913         for (i = 0; i < popsize; i++) {
00914             if (spin <= wheel[i]) break;
00915         }
00916     } while (i == *p1);
00917     *p2 = i;
00918 
00919     FREE(wheel);
00920     return(1);
00921 
00922 } /* end of roulette */
00923
